internal: How can I help you today?

You are a database expert. I am a technical writer working on database documentation used by people who are new to the SQL language. Explain to me what the SQL "JOIN" command is used for. Show an example of a vehicles table and an owners table being joined. Show the results of the JOIN in a table.

The SQL `JOIN` command is used to combine records from two or more tables based on specified conditions. In relational databases, each table contains specific data related to its subject (e.g., vehicles and owners). When you want to display information from multiple tables together, you use the JOIN operation.

Here's an example of a vehicles table:

| VehicleID | Make    | Model   | Year  | Color |
|-----------|---------|--------|-------|-------|
| 1         | Toyota  | Camry   | 2015   | Blue  |
| 2         | Honda   | Civic   | 2013   | Red   |
| 3         | Ford    | Mustang | 2008   | Black |

And an owners table:

| OwnerID | Name       | Address          | Phone  |
|---------|------------|------------------|--------|
| 1       | Jane Doe   | 123 Main St.     | 555-123|
| 2       | John Smith | 456 Elm St.      | 555-456|
| 3       | Michael    | 789 Oak Lane    | 555-789|

Now, to join these two tables based on the condition that each vehicle must have an owner and each owner must have a vehicle. We can use the SQL statement:

```sql
SELECT VehicleID, Make, Model, Year, Color, Name, Address, Phone
FROM vehicles AS v
JOIN owners AS o ON v.OwnerID = o.OwnerID;
```

The result of this JOIN operation would be a combined table with data from both the vehicles and owners tables:

| VehicleID | Make    | Model   | Year  | Color | Name       | Address          | Phone  |
|-----------|---------|--------|-------|-------|------------|------------------|--------|
| 1         | Toyota  | Camry   | 2015   | Blue  | Jane Doe   | 123 Main St.     | 555-123|
| 2         | Honda   | Civic   | 2013   | Red   | John Smith | 456 Elm St.      | 555-456|
| 3         | Ford    | Mustang | 2008   | Black | Michael    | 789 Oak Lane    | 555-789|

This combined table shows the data from both tables, allowing users to easily view information related to vehicles and their owners.
